title: 1 million IP goal
body:
Hello, my name is Dread Return from NA, and I've been playing this game since season 2. I currently have 956,000 IP. I am hoping or wishing that when I reach 1 million IP, if by any chance I can get a shot to play with riot people on ARAM or something. To celebrate my accomplishment. it may be a long while, I still have a long way to go, 44K more to go, but when I ro reach it, I just wish to celebrate it by playing with some riot people.

I know you're all busy, but hope fully this small request of mine can be at least considered.

Very respectfully,
Dread Return (NA)

As someone who has been playing for years, and has compiled a very impressive stockpile of ip, what do you think about the new player experience? For newer players the daunting task of accumulating over 40k ip has cause a lot of players to quit the game but veteran players say it's fine as it is. Should ip gains be raised?

They are making the new player experience worse by giving them easy ways. They cut the XP require to reach level 30 in half. So new players are being put into silver ranked games with literally no clue how to play. Then they're getting "harassed".

My blunt opinion: Said new players should have the wit about them to not try their luck in ranked before they know they're good enough to have a real chance to prove themselves.

I don't care about their "harassment" if they lack the sense to realize they got no business in ranked before having played a rather high number of normal games to get some proper experience.

Yeah, but saying anything like that is "mean" according to this social justice warrior community. But then they'll cry about how "toxic" it is when they don't want to address the things causing it to be so shitty.

I'm struggling to find a phrasing that's not taking this thread too far off topic...
But I'll try, and then I'd like your view or opinion on what is wrong, and then we'll leave it at that.
_I just want something else to spend IP on - the lack of it makes me feel as though I've completed this game now, and should just as well take my leave._

New, _inexperienced_ players got no business in ranked, fact.
Does the current new player experience teach them enough to be able to handle themselves in ranked? No, not really.
That means it's up to themselves to learn how to become a "proper" player (a term that is up for individual judgement - but we all like seeing ourselves as better than we might really be. Which is unfortunate, but it is human nature), and likewise their own responsibility if they fail to do so.

That said, it is the responsibility of all of us to ensure everyone got a good time. And while I don't think ranked is a place to "have a good time", that's still no excuse to treat someone poorly.
"Harrassment" is also something up for individual judgement, as we all take and give statements in any sort of meaning in different ways, and we all also take these statements in different ways, whether it be with a shrug, understand the seriousness in it, start to cry or take a lesson in it on what not to do in the future.

There is so much subjectiveness in all this, that it is IMPOSSIBLE to find one solution that suits all.
Even the proverb "treat other like you yourself would like to be treated" is a no-go due to all the different societies around the world.
I see the phrase "kurwa", I report that person for the sake of it (though depending on my perception of the context), despite it might it a perfectly acceptable swear-word in that person's local community.
_That said, if that person are unable to understand that word is not encessarily acceptable everywhere else, he/she does not have a place here._

So, to summarize: we're stuck with this issue. Always has been, and likely always will be.

Your turn; I'd like your views on this before we stop this line of discussion in this thread.
I don't see a reason it shouldn't.
